thread.title: 18 Best Bets for Tacos, Tex-Mex, and Mexican Near SXSW in Austin
thread.title_full: 18 Best Bets for Tacos, Tex-Mex, and Mexican Near SXSW in Austin

author: Elizabeth Leader Smith
title: 18 Best Bets for Tacos, Tex-Mex, and Mexican Near SXSW in Austin
text:
Mar 6, 2017, 12:02pm CST La Condesa La Condesa/Facebook 
Austin boasts an abundance of tacos, Tex-Mex, and Mexican options, from life-changing cheesy queso, breakfast tacos, to interior Mexican fare. In addition to getting your barbecue fill during SXSW , no trip to Austin is complete without trying tons of tacos, comparing queso notes, and truly understanding that Tex-Mex and Mexican food are two separate things. 
This is Eater’s updated guide to the very best tacos, Tex-Mex, and Mexican cuisine within easy striking distance of the downtown convention center. Highlights include the best spots for humble yet holy migas , a vegan Tex-Mex brunch to cure what ails you, quick and easy tacos when you've got no time, and where to find a contemporary take on interior Mexican cuisine (with an impressive tequila selection to boot). There are longtime local favorites like Veracruz All Natural and Joe's Bakery & Coffee Shop , along with newcomers like Vaquero Taquero . So pull up a seat, dig in, and start planning. 
For more ideas, explore Austin's best breakfast tacos , and check out Eater's taco heatmap . Everything below is listed in an unranked order. 1 Chi'Lantro 
For breakfast tacos right in downtown, Chi’lantro’s truck dishes out $3 breakfast tacos, made using spicy pork, beef ribeye, eggs, bacon, cheese, and all of the works, starting bright and early at 7 a.m. until 2 p.m. Catch 'em down at the SouthBites trailer park as well. Remember: Chi'lantro does not accept cash.
